title: Prospective Marriage visa
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Prospective Marriage visa (Subclass 300), which allows applicants to travel to Australia to marry their prospective spouse and later apply for a Partner visa. It includes eligibility requirements, costs, conditions, obligations, and application procedures.

structured_data.description: This temporary visa lets applicants come to Australia to marry their prospective spouse and then apply for a Partner visa.
structured_data.stay_duration: 9 to 15 months from date of visa grant

cost.additional_family_member_fees: Additional fees apply for each family member included
cost.note: Correct visa application charge must be paid or application cannot be processed

pricing_tools.visa_pricing_estimator: Available online; does not include health checks, police certificates, or biometrics

cost.partner_visa_cost_note: Applicants pay less for Partner visa (subclasses 820 and 801) if they marry before the Prospective Marriage visa ends

processing_times.note: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent processing times; these are indicative only

with_this_visa_you_can: Stay in Australia for 9 to 15 months from visa grant date
Travel to and from Australia multiple times while visa is valid
Apply for a Partner visa after marriage and before this visa expires

eligibility.age: Applicants and sponsors must be 18 years or older

location_requirements.when_applying: Applicant and family members must be outside Australia
location_requirements.when_decided: Applicant can be inside or outside Australia

conditions: Sponsor must be the prospective spouse
Both must have met in person as adults since turning 18
Must be personally known to each other at time of application
Sponsor must be approved by the Department

relationship_requirements.must_intend_to_marry: Applicant must intend to marry prospective spouse before visa expires
relationship_requirements.marriage_validity: Marriage can occur in any country but must be valid under Australian law

health_requirements.non_travelling_family: May also need to meet health requirement

character_requirements.non_travelling_family: Character information may also be required

visa_history.cancellation_or_refusal: Previous visa cancellations or refusals may affect eligibility

family_members.can_include: Family members can be included when lodging the application or added as dependent children before visa decision
conditions: Must be members of the family unit
Must meet health and character requirements
family_members.non_travelling_family: May be asked to meet health and character requirements
family_members.newborn_children: See 'You had a baby' for instructions

application_information.location_requirement: Applicant and family must be outside Australia when applying
application_information.how_to_apply: Sponsor should apply as soon as possible after visa application

marriage_requirements: Must enter Australia before the date specified on grant letter
Must marry prospective spouse before visa expires

forced_marriage_warning.description: Forced marriage is a crime in Australia
forced_marriage_warning.definition: Marriage without full and free consent, possibly involving threat, pressure, or lack of capacity

health_insurance.recommendation: Applicants are advised to get adequate health insurance
health_insurance.liability_note: Applicants are personally liable for all healthcare costs
health_insurance.reciprocal_healthcare_agreements: Some countries have agreements with Australia

travel_information.travel_flexibility: Unlimited travel to and from Australia during visa validity
travel_information.first_entry_arrival_date: If outside Australia at grant, must enter before date specified in grant letter

visa_label.note: Visa is digitally linked to passport; no physical label is provided
